title: Working on a Keen fangame!
content:
I just started it today.

It's not anywhere near complete, but some sprites are done, the backround is done and I'm working on the objects.

I am using GameMaker.

I almost used my own backround, but I lost it,[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] and I'm to lazy to redo it,[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] So I just took it from cosmo's cosmetic adventure using wombat, a blank CD, and that CD burnin' program.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]

I'll try to get more done.A proud member of the beta testing society
[url=http://www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html]www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html[/url]
Down with VGA! Up with EGA!
Email me a beta at [url=mailto:HarveySmiths3rdemail@hotmail.com] HarveySmiths3rdemail@hotmail.com[/url]! :-)

title: Re: Working on a Keen fangame!
content:
Shouldnt this topic be in the unoffical games section? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Anyways any screens of the sprites yet?
Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]
Check out my fanfics at [url=http://www.fanfiction.net/u/680124/]fanfiction.net[/url]

title: D-:<
content:
I decided to abandon it. It's just too buggy to continue.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

...Can I email it to someone anyways?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] A proud member of the beta testing society
[url=http://www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html]www.garfield.com/comics/comics_todays.html[/url]
Down with VGA! Up with EGA!

title: Re: D-:<
content:
If it;s too buggy to continue, the who would want you to email it to them?We want Keen 7
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?MultiMANIA]We want it now![/url]

title: Re: D-:<
content:
Games are supposed to be buggy after 1 day of work.
This doesn't automatically mean you were right on track after all and shouldn't give up, I'm just saying that's (also) the usual way games evolve.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: D-:<
content:
That was fast. At least you sensibly decided to abandon it - many people with similar skill to you continued work on their fangames and we ended up with hundreds of buggy fangames as a result.
[quote]Quote:[hr]...Can I email it to someone anyways? [hr][/quote]
Umm... why would anyone want a buggy, unfinished fangame with only a day's work done on it?

title: Re: D-:<
content: Hhhhhhhrrrg [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img]  maybe it's smart to think before you try to make a keen fangame , start with something easy and do some googelingI am the bad you are the ugly There is no good
